Class DbFunctions

java.lang.Object
DbFunctions
public class DbFunctions
extends java.lang.Object
This class is used to connect to the database and has several functions that let's you create and manage it
Author:
Refined Storage developers

  • Method Details

    • com

      public static void com() throws java.lang.Throwable
      This method is used to create the database. It creates the tables user, material, orders and quantity if they do not already exist. It also inputs values into the table user, orders, and quantity
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - SQLException

    • get_material_from_ID

      public java.lang.String get_material_from_ID​(int id)
      This method is used to get the name that is correspondent to the passed param id
      Parameters:
      id - - the desired id
      Returns:
      the name of the correspondent id

    • get_prio_from_ID

      public int get_prio_from_ID​(int id)
      This method is used to get the priority(admin, employee) of the corresponding id
      Parameters:
      id - - the specified id
      Returns:
      1 in case of admin, 2 in case of employee, 0 in case of error

    • getName_and_pw_FromID

      public java.lang.String[] getName_and_pw_FromID​(int id)
      This method is used to get the name and password of the corresponding id
      Parameters:
      id - - the desired id
      Returns:
      string with the name and password of the desired id

    • listUsers

      public java.sql.ResultSet listUsers() throws java.lang.Throwable
      This method is used to list some of the values that exist in the table users (id, name, priority)
      Returns:
      the result set that contains the users
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - SQLException - if a database access error occurs or the url is null , SQLTimeoutException - when the driver has determined that the timeout value specified by the setLoginTimeout method has been exceeded and has at least tried to cancel the current database connection attempt

    • login

      public temp_user_from_db login​(int id, java.lang.String pass) throws java.lang.Throwable
      This method is used to check if the id and password that are passed are present in the database
      Parameters:
      id - - pretended id
      pass - - password of the corresponding id
      Returns:
      the temp_user_from_db
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - SQLException

    • check_id

      public static boolean check_id​(int id, java.lang.String table) throws java.lang.Throwable
      This method is used to see if the wanted id already exists in the determined table
      Parameters:
      id - - the pretended id
      table - - the pretended table (user, material, orders)
      Returns:
      true if the id exists in the table, false if it doesn't
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - SQLException

    • CheckValidId

      public int CheckValidId​(java.lang.String text)
      This method checks if the string text can be converted into a valid integer
      Parameters:
      text - - the intended text for conversion
      Returns:
      returns the number of the valid integer, else returns 0 in case of an invalid string to integer conversion
